result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler P Belk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler P Belk

defendant.name: Belk, Tyler P
defendant.address: 9214 W Schlinger Ave, West Allis, WI 53214

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tyler P Belk in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant sentenced to the following. 

COUNT#1:

FINE:   $363.25, to be paid within 60 days, or serve 7 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine

Expunction is conditionally granted, in 12 months, upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
to appear filed by Attorney Beth Weathers

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Tyler P Belk did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler P Belk in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Tyler P Belk in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
